data.fullContent: Cholesterol, a type of fat molecule, can be found in the cells of animals and humans. If the levels of cholesterol in the blood are too high, this can damage the heart or cause heart disease. As a result, medical professionals often recommend that adults test their cholesterol levels every 4-6 years. There is ample cholesterol in foods such as eggs, cheeses, seafood, and meats.
data.answer: 胆固醇是一种脂肪分子，可以在动物和人类的细胞中找到。如果血液中的胆固醇水平过高，这可能会损害心脏或导致心脏病。因此，医学专家经常建议成年人每4-6年检测一次胆固醇水平。鸡蛋、奶酪、海鲜和肉类等食物中含有丰富的胆固醇。
